meanings.definition: Five times as great or as numerous.
meanings.sent1: The team's fivefold victory was celebrated by all.
meanings.sent2: The cake was cut into fivefold pieces for everyone to enjoy.
meanings.sent3: The fivefold increase in candy sales left the store owner smiling.
meanings.sent4: Her fivefold excitement was like a burst of colorful fireworks.
meanings.sent5: The fivefold growth of flowers in the garden was a sight to behold.

meanings.definition: To increase or be increased five times.
meanings.sent1: She hoped her savings would fivefold by the end of the year.
meanings.sent2: The population of the town fivefolded in just a decade.
meanings.sent3: The magician's hat seemed to fivefold in size as he pulled out more rabbits.
meanings.sent4: His happiness fivefolded when he received the unexpected good news.
meanings.sent5: The music's volume fivefolded, filling the room with sound.

meanings.definition: Consisting of five parts or members.
meanings.sent1: The fivefold puzzle was challenging to put together.
meanings.sent2: The necklace had a fivefold design, with five delicate chains intertwined.
meanings.sent3: The fivefold team worked together seamlessly to achieve their goal.
meanings.sent4: The fivefold structure stood tall against the strong winds.
meanings.sent5: The fivefold star on the flag symbolized unity and strength.
